column2: Built in the ancient traditional style of Bhutan, The Dechencholing Palace is recorded to have been originally constructed in the Antediluvian age by one of Bhutan's first Emperors. It has continued to grow over time, now existing as a great palace complex which has taken up the majority of Thimphu Valley. It acts as the home of the Imperial family and the headquarters of the Dragonguard of Bhutan the sacred protectors of the emperor.

According to Greek chroniclers the Parthenon was built long ago, even before the event it was ancient. According to these chroniclers it was built by ancient Hellenics in the time of Zeus, it fell into disrepair as Zeus lost followers. Now in the era of Anaxorgos it was restored as a place of worship for the Greek world. Here all of the modern Hellenic gods are worshipped, however Anaxorgos is worshipped above all others as the new Pan-Hellenas.
The White Tower has seen multiple uses throughout different eras before the event, from a fortress, to a prison, to a garrison to a museum.

This wall is one of the three great walls of the Ukraine which irrigate the land and provide cleaner water for the people of the Ukraine. They are believed to have been build in the Antediluvian age from a strange material which is highly resistant to wear. The rulers of the region also make use of these structures as fortification as they are the primary routes across the Dnieper River.

The great palace of Soroca was built post-event at the height of power for Transnistria and as such is a great complex of buildings at the very heart of the empire. It acts as both the residence of the emperor and his family as well as the administrative core for the empire. His imperial guards the Jurat Guard also reside here in other to protect his majesty. The remains of Emperor Adrian I were also interred in its chapel once the Palace was constructed.

When the dogermen's ancestors first arrived on doggerland they discovered an abundance of seadragon bones. These bones became a major part of the doggerlander's faith and constructed a temple in which to contain the bones of these ancient sea dragons. Before a Doggerlander captain goes raiding it is traditional for them to kiss a dragon bone in proportion to the size of their raid.

This ancient structure according to modern chroniclers goes significantly further back than the event however its exact age is lost to time. Strangely it appears to be constructed of the same material as younger Antediluvian buildings. This has suggested to modern historians that the Antediluvian golden age was a long one indeed. In the modern period it has been partially restored to act as a forum for clergy to debate theology.

Whether for drinking or medicinal purposes, this alcohol is popular with passersby and those who choose to stay in the hospital’s surplus beds when times are good.

Sown with medicinal herbs as well as basic staples, these well-kept fields provide for all who chose to make use of the hospital’s services, medical or otherwise, with surplus available for purchase at request.
Stocked with farms animals of all shapes and sizes, these pens provide for both the edible and medicinal needs of the hospital.
While set up to be a house of healing, when times are good the hospital makes this wing available for travelers in need of a place to rest for the night in exchange for a small donation.

Access to clean drinking water is possibly one of the single best ways to slow the spread of disease and to improve the economic health of a province, though obviously it cannot compare to antediluvian plumbing.
Structures built to in an organised fashion dispose of human bodily waste and protect from the spread of disease county wide.
A small array of Wooden Chedi was erected and left to decays then rebuilt for the monk to gains insight on the unforgiving nature of Samsara, Where pain is unescapable and death is inevitable.
